author: Staff Reporter
text:
Residents of Moovarasanpettai village panchayat organised a rally and a meeting on Sunday in support of their demand of merging with the Chennai Corporation. Located between Pallavaram Municipality and Alandur zone of Chennai Corporation, this village panchayat has been deprived of basic amenities, residents complained.

More than 600 participants held placards urging the State Government to make an announcement about the merger of the local body with the Corporation, before the Assembly elections.

Poor roads and inadequate sanitation dotted their locality, residents said. “The village panchayat administration is unable to look after our drinking water requirements, bring in an underground drainage system to their locality and ensure a proper solid waste management system,” pointed out G.P. Babu, secretary, Federation of Residents Welfare Associations of Moovarasanpettai.

N.L. Govindan, a resident of Raghava Nagar, said the panchayat shared its borders with Alandur and Keelkattalai in Pallavaram Municipality, Ullagaram-Puzhuthivakkam and Madipakkam, which have all now become a part of Greater Chennai Corporation, but they have bee left out.
title: ‘Merge Moovarasanpettai with city corporation’
